name: Diwali
description: The festival of lights symbolizing the victory of light over darkness.

name: Holi
description: A vibrant festival of colors celebrated with joy and enthusiasm.

name: Pushkar Camel Fair
description: One of the world's largest camel fairs, featuring trading, competitions, and cultural events.

name: Durga Puja
description: A major festival celebrating the goddess Durga's victory over evil, marked by elaborate decorations and cultural performances.

name: Chhath Puja
description: A festival dedicated to the Sun God, involving holy bathing, fasting, and offerings to the setting and rising sun.

name: Onam
description: A harvest festival celebrated with feasts, boat races, and traditional dances.

name: Hornbill Festival
description: A vibrant celebration showcasing the rich cultural heritage and traditions of Nagaland's tribes.

name: Pongal
description: A harvest festival dedicated to the Sun God, celebrated with traditional cooking and decorations.

name: Ganesh Chaturthi
description: Celebrates the birth of Lord Ganesha with grand processions and immersions of idols.

name: Eid al-Fitr
description: Marks the end of Ramadan, celebrated with prayers, feasts, and charity.

name: Christmas
description: Celebrates the birth of Jesus Christ with midnight masses, carols, and festive decorations.

name: Rath Yatra
description: A grand chariot festival dedicated to Lord Jagannath, with massive processions.

name: Baisakhi
description: Celebrates the Sikh New Year and the harvest season with fairs and dances.

name: Makar Sankranti
description: A kite-flying festival marking the transition of the sun into the zodiac sign of Capricorn.

name: Navratri
description: A nine-night festival dedicated to the worship of the goddess Durga, celebrated with dance and fasting.

name: Janmashtami
description: Celebrates the birth of Lord Krishna with fasting, prayers, and reenactments of his life.

name: Gudi Padwa
description: Celebrates the Marathi New Year with street processions and festive foods.

name: Bihu
description: A series of festivals marking the Assamese New Year and harvest season with music and dance.

name: Lohri
description: A popular winter folk festival celebrated with bonfires and traditional songs.

name: Raksha Bandhan
description: Celebrates the bond between brothers and sisters with the tying of rakhis.

name: Saraswati Puja
description: Dedicated to the goddess of knowledge, music, and arts, celebrated with cultural activities.

name: Maha Shivaratri
description: A festival celebrating Lord Shiva, observed with fasting, night vigils, and prayers.

name: Kumbh Mela
description: A massive pilgrimage and festival celebrated at four different locations in India, marked by ritual bathing in rivers.
location: Rotates between Prayagraj, Haridwar, Nashik, and Ujjain
